intro: Rauvolfia molokaiensis var. parvifolia, commonly known as the Molokai rosyblue, is a rare flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is characterized by its small, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of blue or violet flowers that bloom during the summer months. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and along stream banks. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is known for its ornamental value due to its striking floral display. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
